s: UNICOR is the trade name for Federal Prison Industries (FPI): a wholly owned, self-sustaining Government corporation that sells market-priced services and quality goods made by inmates.

s: July 14, 2024 - One reason federal inmates desire UNICOR employment is that it compensates them much better than most work details in the Federal Bureau of Prisons. Most inmates make in the $10-$20 range per month (for 40 hours of recorded work). Maintenance pay (the lowest level) pays $5.25 per month.
